context_bundle.summary: Page Object Model (POM) pattern for UI test maintainability. Encapsulate page interactions in classes. Separate test logic from page structure. Change selectors in one place, not across all tests.

onboarding.quick_start: POM = class per page/component. Methods for user actions (login(), clickButton()). Locators stored in constructor. Tests call methods, not raw selectors. Update selectors in one file.
common_patterns: class LoginPage { constructor(page) { this.page = page; this.usernameInput = page.locator('#username'); } }
async login(user, pass) { await this.usernameInput.fill(user); await this.submitBtn.click(); }
Test uses: const loginPage = new LoginPage(page); await loginPage.login('user', 'pass');

known_errors.solution: Refactor to POM, update selectors in page class only
known_errors.prevention: Always use POM from start, never hardcode selectors in tests
